data.title: A night in Texas
data.text: The check in was smooth and easy the front desk was very friendly.  The room was clean and everything was well taken care of.  In the morning when asking about directions for driving through the cities, they were very friendly and were able to anser the questions.

data.title: Great Experiance
data.text: This hotel was clean and staffed by a team of professionals. The location was easy to get to from either main or local roads with shopping and food establishments within walking distance. The room was well stocked and comfortable with free wifi and lots of TV options.

data.title: Clean Rooms, Comfortable Beds
data.text: Some of my family and I had flown in to attend another family member's wedding.  Even though we had family living in the area, we got a hotel and invited them to stay with us.  The room was clean and the beds were comfortable.  Breakfast was better than some we've had at other hotels.  It was a nice place to congregate and reminesce!

data.title: Great Location
data.text: This is a great location.  Close to Allen Outlet Mall, and near Downtown Mckinney.  Right off of interstate 75. Near a lot of restaurants.  Hotel was clean and rooms were very comfortable.  The have a free all you can eat breakfast.

data.title: Could have been better
data.text: Stayed 5 nights first week and 3 nights second week. A co-worker booked the hotel. First 5 nights, coffee was never left for next morning. By the third day, I was able to stop by the desk and pick some up. Brought leftovers to eat and work in the room. Second night, getting back to room. refrigerator quit and spoiled my food. Second week, TV did not work, WIFI was spotty at best, had to use my "hotspot" to get emails. Many families living in the hotel, kids running around, breakfast was an adventure trying to get past the regular kids who filled 3 plates each, just to take a few bites and trash.

data.title: This hotel simply doesn't care about the guests
data.text:
We had reserved a suite and arrived on September 12 for a 3 night stay.  Our first indication that this hotel has quality issues were all the rag-tag men sitting around the front of the hotel drinking and puffing away on cigarettes.  It made my wife extremely uncomfortable as they ogled her when we walked past.

The gentleman at the front desk was great and extremely helpful.  We were checked in and proceeded to our room.  When we walked in we discovered furniture that was broken and neither of the television sets worked.  There were also stains on the bathroom wall that looked suspiciously like blood.

I walked down to the front desk, told the clerk, and he immediately gave us another suite.  We proceeded to walk down to the new suite.  We went into the room and discovered that the AC unit did not work in the bedroom.  It was well over 85 sweltering degrees in there.  Not acceptable.

Again I walked back to the front desk, told the clerk, and we decided that we would go back to the first suite and he'd switch out the broken furniture and try to get the televisions working.  He was able to get one television working by switching out the remote, and promised that the other TV would be replaced the next day and housekeeping would be notified of the cleanliness issues.

The next morning we checked with the lady at the front desk who assured us that the issues would be taken care of that day while we were out.  When we returned that evening, absolutely none of the problems had been taken care of.  Still no working television, and cleanliness issues in the bathroom were still there.  When I asked the front desk clerk (a different lady), she advised us that it should have been taken care of (it wasn't).  When I asked about the cleanliness issues in the bathroom she said that it was normal for there to be issues in the bathroom, and as a female she understood why there were blood stains on the wall.  What?  Seriously?

I also noticed that the breakfast area is getting extremely shabby-veneer is peeling from the counters, cupboard doors and drawers are broken and hanging askew.   I also noticed that the fire extinguisher in the third floor hallway is out of date for its annual inspection.  There is peeling wallpaper in the hallway and the shards of glass on the floor between rooms 310 and 312 that were there our entire stay, even though housekeeping had their cart sitting right next to it.  The peeling wallpaper would have taken half an hour to fix (seam adhesive and a roller) and the glass simply should have been seen and picked up by housekeeping.  The out-of-date fire extinguisher inspection tell me that management really doesn't care about guest safety. 

We decided to leave a day early because of the issues with this hotel.  While we've always had great service from Best Western hotels, this one falls far short of a quality guest experience.

data.title: Very Nice
data.text: We had a nice stay.  The staff was very friendly. The room rate was modest.  The rooms was very comfortable and I really enjoyed the pool.  I just wish all of the hotels would get rid of the little pillows.  I know they are fashionable, but they are not comfortable.  Typical Best Western breakfast.  But the lady in the breakfast area was exceptionally nice.

data.title: It's okay
data.text: The hotel itself is clean and the staff is friendly.  The breakfast is lacking - typical hotel waffles and cereal. They did have some kind of biscuits (friend say they were gross) and gravy. We ended up going out for breakfast the next day.  It is convenient to downtown McKinney and right off the highway.  The beds are hard as rocks. Even though it's better than some area hotels; I'd probably try someplace different next time.

data.title: Great service - needs new pillows
data.text: I stayed here for a girls weekend getaway and I can say I did have great interaction with the staff. They do need to replace the pillows, they are old and worn out. They are so bad they have to tuck part of the pillow case into its self because of the condition. FYI - if in a car bring your own pillow. The breakfast - personally, I am not a fan of these "free" breakfast buffets - so I might mot be a good judge. I did not care for the cheese wiz omelette but the sausage was OK. My friend isn't too picky and she thought it was OK since it was free. If I was there another night I would have gone somewhere and paid for a good meal. Again I'm not usually a fan and this may be your thing.

data.title: Nice Hotel for the price
data.text: Great place to stay for price and value, easy to find right off highway.  Shopping and restaurants within walking distance .  Very quiet rooms, very clean, very friendly staff.  Good breakfast.  Nice pool. The only con is that they need to get new linens and towels.  A little worn and tired looking.

data.title: Wonderful Stay
data.text: I had a great time at this hotel, it was very clean and the staff was wonderful. The only issues were that the bed was quite uncomfortable and my key card stopped working on both nights I stayed. Luckily the staff was very, concise and wonderful about helping out.

data.title: Satisfied
data.text: Best Western Plus is a good value. The lobby was very nice and clean.  The friendly staff makes a great impression. The room was clean. The bed  and pillows were very comfortable.  Breakfast had  great choices.

data.title: BW MINUS
data.text: This hotel SUCKS Badly and they have the worst customer service from the initial check in to the check out.  I paid for this stay using a third party company and my bill was already paid for before getting to the hotel.  The front desk Dawn informed me of only a $25 incidental charge and nothing else before handing her my debit card.  Next thing I know, $89 was being charged, and had questioned her about the transaction.  She stated that the charge was for the hotel stay after telling her I have already paid for the hotel when I booked it.  She argued about it and in the process was YELLING at me about not being able to do anything about it cause the computer automatically charges it.  I asked her to call the manager and have her reverse it and credit me my stay via Priceline cause I do not like the way I am being disrespected.  After lying that her manager Cindy turns her phone off at midnight, I told her it was only 23:45 and she changes the time to 23:00.  She said that no one higher than her can be called to fix the problem, she was new, and was not trained on how to work the computer.  She even stated there's been worst life threatening scenarios and was not able to call anyone at that time.   I told her we just got back from the airport and I would rather trudge through the two hour drive home then stay in a place as disorganized and rude as this BW.  This location should be called BuTT WiPES for the nerve of a night auditor to yell and argue with a customer who was trying to find a solution to something than wait in the morning till someone would be available.  She guaranteed me if I was to go home that she can have the manager Cindy reverse the charges she made and even approve Priceline to cancel the reservation.  I knew better what bull crap that would be cause I was not about to risk falling asleep at the wheel to drive home to just waste the money I've spent and not get a refund for anything.  When I called Priceline in the morning to see what they manager had decided, they denied the cancelation, and that no apologies or attempt to talk to me directly.  The hotel looks decent from the outside and pictures but I should have known that no BW would have any standards or actual decent amenities, breakfast, or accommodation.  Their towels had stains, beds were very uncomfortably, breakfast was a joke, those Texas Waffles are non existent, toilet would not flush, and there are no hospitality in the front desk and manager.  Anyone wants to do a class action law suit, hit me up, and we will force these idiots to get their acts together.

data.title: Good night sleep
data.text:
Very nice hotel. Clean, friendly staff.  
Great hot breakfast. The lady in the breakfast area was so nice,she seem to be very happy with her job. 
The only things that kept me from rating it a 5 was the beds were a Little hard for my taste, and Even though it was right on the hwy. it was hard to get to it. Price was good. 
We had 3 adults and 2 kids. Had lots of room. If ever I'm in that area again I will stay there again.

data.title: Vacation stop over
data.text: Our initial King bed room reeked with cigarette odor. The girl at the front desk was very nice. Not only did she apologize for the bad odor, she was very helpful in getting us another room. Since we are also Platinum members with BW we were upgraded to a suite. Overall our stay was very enjoyable.

data.title: Traveled half way across the country to be disappointed with Best Western.
data.text: We arrived on Thursday 7/14/16 to find the A/C not working in half of our "Suite." Maintenance swapped it out for another one, which was appreciated. I'm pretty sure they just took it from another room, as my nieces arrived the following day to find their A/C not working and you could tell that the one in their room had just been put in, as the cord was out in front of the unit. Their A/C in half their suite was NEVER repaired for their 3 night stay, but part of the suite did have air. Several other people we spoke to were also without A/C and no maintenance people showed up all weekend to fix it. In our "Suite" I was to stay on a hide a bed couch. I pulled it out and it was ripped and had a huge stain on it. The photos I took are cringe worthy. I went to the desk to ask for bedding, a mattress pad or something and was told they were out. I was given 2 sheets. So I slept on the couch folded up which was not comfortable at all. The next day they provided me a roll away bed which required a pillow under one side of the mattress to make it level enough to sleep on. This I paid 149.99 per night for. We called other hotels to try and get out of there, they were all booked up so we were stuck. As far as the cleanliness goes, lobby and breakfast area were clean, but stairway railings were covered in dust and carpets needed shampooed. Calls to the owner by other family staying there went unanswered.  Would I recommend to a friend, no.

data.title: No Air conditioning & room wasn't what I paid for!
data.text:
NO AIR CONDITIONING! Go somewhere else!! 

The owner is a complete jerk and threatened to call the police on us because we want the AC fixed. He told his manager "why won't they just leave?" We would love to but there is nowhere else to go!!! 

This has been and continues to be the WORST hotel experience I've ever had!! We paid for a king suite with a pull out bed because we have two babies that need separate rooms. When we arrived, our room felt like a sauna. Neither AC unit was working and the two cribs we had called and reserved (one reason we chose this hotel) were nowhere to be found. Night staff eventually (2 hours later) let us move to a different suite but failed to mention that there was no pull out bed. So with no cribs and no pull out bed, we now have 4 people in a room with one bed when we paid extra specifically for the suite. But wait... It gets better!! One of the 2 AC units in our new room is broken, so we are still sweating. We can't close the bedroom door (and separate the babies) because there's no AC in the living room. It's been 48 hours and the "maintenance" that would supposedly be here "first thing in the morning" has yet to show up. They're "having problems with him" but refuse to call someone else. There are no other rooms, the hotel is booked solid, and no rooms at surrounding hotels so we are literally stuck with nowhere else to go.  

So after two nights of sleeping on a small couch with my 1.5 year old, I am completely fed up. The owners solution is to give us $20 off.... This room should have been $20 less to begin with as its smaller and is meant for 2 people, not 4. That's not even considering the lack of air conditioning in TEXAS in JULY! 

This is the worst I've ever been treated by a business owner/management and it's very clear they don't care about their customers. Huge waste of money and time and the owner acts like we just want a free room... No, we want what you advertise on your site... Air conditioning and the room we booked!!!

data.title: Terrible night's sleep!!
data.text: Beds are very uncomfortable...Lots of road noise , and someone upstairs walking around all night. Great location,  just had terrible night's sleep due to bed. Other BW'S have great beds, so disappointed by this one.

data.title: Very serviceable
data.text:
From start to finish, my stay was pleasant. The front desk staff was terrific. They even gave me a room on a higher floor when I requested one upon check-in. 
The room was very clean and very comfortable. I had a king size bed and I slept very well.
The inn is extremely quiet so there were no slamming doors or screaming people which is always appreciated. 
I like that it is small with only three floors, and I felt very safe even coming back late at night.
House cleaning stuff does a great job and is very friendly when you come upon them in the hallway.

Minor quibbles:
The pool does not have any umbrellas and therefore empty and in the blistering heat of June, I would recommend that they invest in some. 
The free breakfast was fine. The person replenishing the food was very nice and polite and greeted everyone. Have the waffles or biscuits and gravy with the link sausage. 
The somewhat remote location is really meant for someone who will be renting a car or getting a ride from friends. It is really not a walking around neighborhood most especially at night.  
There is a whattaburger just across the street from the hotel where I enjoyed a tasty snack the first evening.

data.title: Great Choice for a Hotel
data.text: The staff was courteous and helpful, and the room was very clean. I loved the pool time and the fitness room is a plus.  Great breakfast and overall, Best Western Plus in McKinney, TX, is a place I will book again when I visit family.

owner_response.author: Vijay P, Guest Relations Manager at BEST WESTERN PLUS McKinney Inn & Suites, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the kind comments.....and we look forward to having you stay with us again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
